name: (1E)-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3193
Reason: 1E-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide has a complex structure with multiple functional groups. The basic unit for comparison is ethanimidamide, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The 4-methylphenyl group introduces a more rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The amino group introduces a basic nitrogen, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The piperidine ring introduces a more rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The methylene bridge introduces a more rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius.
